text: Ajoy Kumar Dutta is an Indian social worker from the northeast Indian state of Assam. \- He is a Guwahati-based activist who is associated with several non governmental organizations working in the state. A former municipal councillor at the Guwahati Municipal Corporation, he successfully contested the Assam Assembly Elections of 1978 as a Janata Party candidate defeating Nandeshwar Talukdar of the Communist Party of India by polling close to 34 percent of the total votes polled, and represented the Guwahati East constituency in the Assembly. The Government of India awarded him the fourth highest civilian honour of the Padma Shri, in 2016, for his contributions to society. == References == == External links == * Category:Recipients of the Padma Shri in social work Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Politicians from Guwahati Category:Indian male social workers Category:Janata Party politicians Category:Assam MLAs 1978–1983 Category:20th- century Indian educators Category:Social workers from Assam Category:Living people
title: Ajoy Kumar Dutta
